00001 c
00002 c          ##########################################################################
00003 c          #                                                                        #
00004 c          #                             GEOPACK-2003                               #
00005 c          #                     (MAIN SET OF FORTRAN CODES)                        #
00006 c          #                                                                        #
00007 c          ##########################################################################
00008 C
00009 c
00010 c  This collection of subroutines is a result of several upgrades of the original package
00011 c  written by N. A. Tsyganenko in 1978-1979. This version is dated April 22, 2003.
00012 c
00013 c
00014 c  This package represents an in-depth revision of the previous version, with significant
00015 c  changes in the format of calling statements. Users should familiarize themselves with
00016 c  the new formats and rules, and accordingly adjust their source codes, as specified
00017 c  below. Please consult the documentation file geopack-2003.doc (also available from this
00018 c  site) for detailed descriptions of individual subroutines.
00019 c
00020 c  The following changes were made to the previous release of GEOPACK (Jan 5, 2001).
00021 c
00022 c (1) Subroutine IGRF, calculating the Earth's main field:
00023 
00024 c   (a) Two versions of this subroutine are provided here. In the first one (IGRF_GSM)
00025 c     both input (position) and output (field components) are in the Geocentric Solar-
00026 c     Magnetospheric Cartesian coordinates, while the second one (IGRF_GEO) uses sphe-
00027 c     rical geographical (geocentric) coordinates, as in the older releases.
00028 
00029 c   (b) updating of all expansion coefficients is now made separately in the s/r RECALC,
00030 c     which also takes into account the secular change of the coefficients within
00031 c     a given year (at the Earth's surface, the rate of the change can reach 7 nT/month).
00032 
00033 c   (c) the optimal length of spherical harmonic expansions is now automatically set
00034 c     inside the code, based on the radial distance, so that the deviation from the
00035 c     full-length approximation does not exceed 0.01 nT. (In the previous versions,
00036 c     the upper limit NM of the order of harmonics had to be specified by users),
00037 c
00038 c  (2) Subroutine DIP, calculating the Earth's field in the dipole approximation:
00039 
00040 c   (a) no longer accepts the tilt angle via the list of formal parameters. Instead,
00041 c     the sine SPS and cosine CPS of that angle are now forwarded into DIP via the
00042 c     first common block /GEOPACK1/.  Accordingly, there are two options: (i) to
00043 c     calculate SPS and CPS by calling RECALC before calling DIP, or (ii) to specify
00044 c     them explicitly. In the last case, SPS and CPS should be specified AFTER the
00045 c     invocation of RECALC (otherwise they would be overridden by those returned by
00046 c     RECALC).
00047 
00048 c   (b) the Earth's dipole moment is now calculated by RECALC, based on the table of
00049 c     the IGRF coefficients and their secular variation rates, for a given year and
00050 c     the day of the year, and the obtained value of the moment is forwarded into DIP
00051 c     via the second common block /GEOPACK2/. (In the previous versions, only a single
00052 c     fixed value was provided for the geodipole moment, corresponding to the most
00053 c     recent epoch).
00054 c
00055 c  (3) Subroutine RECALC now consolidates in one module all calculations needed to
00056 c     initialize and update the values of coefficients and quantities that vary in
00057 c     time, either due to secular changes of the main geomagnetic field or as a result
00058 c     of Earth's diurnal rotation and orbital motion around Sun. That allowed us to
00059 c     simplify the codes and make them more compiler-independent.
00060 c
00061 c  (4) Subroutine GEOMAG is now identical in its structure to other coordinate trans-
00062 c     formation subroutines. It no longer invokes RECALC from within GEOMAG, but uses
00063 c     precalculated values of the rotation matrix elements, obtained by a separate
00064 c     external invocation of RECALC. This eliminates possible interference of the
00065 c     two subroutines in the old version of the package.
00066 c
00067 c  (5) Subroutine TRACE (and the subsidiary modules STEP and RHAND):
00068 c
00069 c   (a) no longer needs to specify the highest order of spherical harmonics in the
00070 c     main geomagnetic field expansion - it is now calculated automatically inside the
00071 c     IGRF_GSM (or IGRF_GEO) subroutine.
00072 c
00073 c   (b) the internal field model can now be explicitly chosen by specifying the para-
00074 c      meter INNAME (either IGRF_GSM or DIP).
00075 c
00076 c  (6) A new subroutine BCARSP was added, providing a conversion of Cartesian field
00077 c     components into spherical ones (operation, inverse to that performed by the sub-
00078 c     routine  BSPCAR).
00079 c
00080 c  (7) Two new subroutines were added, SHUETAL_MGNP and T96_MGNP, providing the position
00081 c     of the magnetopause, according to the model of Shue et al. [1998] and the one
00082 c     used in the T96 magnetospheric magnetic field model.
00083 c
00084 c
00085 c----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00086 c
00087       SUBROUTINE IGRF_GSM (XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM,HXGSM,HYGSM,HZGSM)
00088       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00089 c
00090 C  CALCULATES COMPONENTS OF THE MAIN (INTERNAL) GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IN THE GEOCENTRIC SOLAR
00091 C  MAGNETOSPHERIC COORDINATE SYSTEM, USING IAGA INTERNATIONAL GEOMAGNETIC REFERENCE MODEL
00092 C  COEFFICIENTS  (e.g., http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/IAGA/wg8/igrf2000.html)
00093 C
00094 C  BEFORE THE FIRST CALL OF THIS SUBROUTINE, OR IF THE DATE/TIME (IYEAR,IDAY,IHOUR,MIN,ISEC)
00095 C  WAS CHANGED, THE MODEL COEFFICIENTS AND GEO-GSM ROTATION MATRIX ELEMENTS SHOULD BE UPDATED
00096 c  BY CALLING THE SUBROUTINE RECALC
00097 C
00098 C-----INPUT PARAMETERS:
00099 C
00100 C     XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM - CARTESIAN GSM COORDINATES (IN UNITS RE=6371.2 KM)
00101 C
00102 C-----OUTPUT PARAMETERS:
00103 C
00104 C     HXGSM,HYGSM,HZGSM - CARTESIAN GSM COMPONENTS OF THE MAIN GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IN NANOTESLA
00105 C
00106 C     LAST MODIFICATION:  MARCH 30, 2003.
00107 C     THIS VERSION OF THE  CODE ACCEPT DATES FROM 1965 THROUGH 2005.
00108 c
00109 C     AUTHOR: N. A. TSYGANENKO
00110 C
00111 C
00112       COMMON /GEOPACK2/ G(66),H(66),REC(66)
00113 
00114       DIMENSION A(11),B(11)
00115 
00116       CALL GEOGSM (XGEO,YGEO,ZGEO,XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM,-1)
00117       RHO2=XGEO**2+YGEO**2
00118       R=SQRT(RHO2+ZGEO**2)
00119       C=ZGEO/R
00120       RHO=SQRT(RHO2)
00121       S=RHO/R
00122       IF (S.LT.1.E-5) THEN
00123         CF=1.
00124         SF=0.
00125       ELSE
00126         CF=XGEO/RHO
00127         SF=YGEO/RHO
00128       ENDIF
00129 C
00130       PP=1./R
00131       P=PP
00132 C
00133 C  IN THIS NEW VERSION, THE OPTIMAL VALUE OF THE PARAMETER NM (MAXIMAL ORDER OF THE SPHERICAL
00134 C    HARMONIC EXPANSION) IS NOT USER-PRESCRIBED, BUT CALCULATED INSIDE THE SUBROUTINE, BASED
00135 C      ON THE VALUE OF THE RADIAL DISTANCE R:
00136 C
00137       IRP3=R+3
00138       NM=4+30/IRP3
00139       IF (NM.GT.10) NM=10
00140 
00141       K=NM+1
00142       DO 150 N=1,K
00143          P=P*PP
00144          A(N)=P
00145 150      B(N)=P*N
00146 
00147       P=1.
00148       D=0.
00149       BBR=0.
00150       BBT=0.
00151       BBF=0.
00152 
00153       DO 200 M=1,K
00154          IF(M.EQ.1) GOTO 160
00155          MM=M-1
00156          W=X
00157          X=W*CF+Y*SF
00158          Y=Y*CF-W*SF
00159          GOTO 170
00160 160      X=0.
00161          Y=1.
00162 170      Q=P
00163          Z=D
00164          BI=0.
00165          P2=0.
00166          D2=0.
00167          DO 190 N=M,K
00168             AN=A(N)
00169             MN=N*(N-1)/2+M
00170             E=G(MN)
00171             HH=H(MN)
00172             W=E*Y+HH*X
00173             BBR=BBR+B(N)*W*Q
00174             BBT=BBT-AN*W*Z
00175             IF(M.EQ.1) GOTO 180
00176             QQ=Q
00177             IF(S.LT.1.E-5) QQ=Z
00178             BI=BI+AN*(E*X-HH*Y)*QQ
00179 180         XK=REC(MN)
00180             DP=C*Z-S*Q-XK*D2
00181             PM=C*Q-XK*P2
00182             D2=Z
00183             P2=Q
00184             Z=DP
00185 190        Q=PM
00186          D=S*D+C*P
00187          P=S*P
00188          IF(M.EQ.1) GOTO 200
00189          BI=BI*MM
00190          BBF=BBF+BI
00191 200   CONTINUE
00192 C
00193       BR=BBR
00194       BT=BBT
00195       IF(S.LT.1.E-5) GOTO 210
00196       BF=BBF/S
00197       GOTO 211
00198 210   IF(C.LT.0.) BBF=-BBF
00199       BF=BBF
00200 
00201 211   HE=BR*S+BT*C
00202       HXGEO=HE*CF-BF*SF
00203       HYGEO=HE*SF+BF*CF
00204       HZGEO=BR*C-BT*S
00205 
00206       CALL GEOGSM (HXGEO,HYGEO,HZGEO,HXGSM,HYGSM,HZGSM,1)
00207 
00208       RETURN
00209       END
00210 C
00211 c==========================================================================================
00212 C
00213 c
00214       SUBROUTINE IGRF_GEO (R,THETA,PHI,BR,BTHETA,BPHI)
00215       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00216 c
00217 C  CALCULATES COMPONENTS OF THE MAIN (INTERNAL) GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IN THE SPHERICAL GEOGRAPHIC
00218 C  (GEOCENTRIC) COORDINATE SYSTEM, USING IAGA INTERNATIONAL GEOMAGNETIC REFERENCE MODEL
00219 C  COEFFICIENTS  (e.g., http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/IAGA/wg8/igrf2000.html)
00220 C
00221 C  BEFORE THE FIRST CALL OF THIS SUBROUTINE, OR IF THE DATE (IYEAR AND IDAY) WAS CHANGED,
00222 C  THE MODEL COEFFICIENTS SHOULD BE UPDATED BY CALLING THE SUBROUTINE RECALC
00223 C
00224 C-----INPUT PARAMETERS:
00225 C
00226 C   R, THETA, PHI - SPHERICAL GEOGRAPHIC (GEOCENTRIC) COORDINATES:
00227 C   RADIAL DISTANCE R IN UNITS RE=6371.2 KM, COLATITUDE THETA AND LONGITUDE PHI IN RADIANS
00228 C
00229 C-----OUTPUT PARAMETERS:
00230 C
00231 C     BR, BTHETA, BPHI - SPHERICAL COMPONENTS OF THE MAIN GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IN NANOTESLA
00232 C      (POSITIVE BR OUTWARD, BTHETA SOUTHWARD, BPHI EASTWARD)
00233 C
00234 C     LAST MODIFICATION:  MARCH 30, 2003.
00235 C     THIS VERSION OF THE  CODE ACCEPT DATES FROM 1965 THROUGH 2005.
00236 c
00237 C     AUTHOR: N. A. TSYGANENKO
00238 C
00239 C
00240       COMMON /GEOPACK2/ G(66),H(66),REC(66)
00241 
00242       DIMENSION A(11),B(11)
00243 
00244       C=COS(THETA)
00245       S=SIN(THETA)
00246       CF=COS(PHI)
00247       SF=SIN(PHI)
00248 C
00249       PP=1./R
00250       P=PP
00251 C
00252 C  IN THIS NEW VERSION, THE OPTIMAL VALUE OF THE PARAMETER NM (MAXIMAL ORDER OF THE SPHERICAL
00253 C    HARMONIC EXPANSION) IS NOT USER-PRESCRIBED, BUT CALCULATED INSIDE THE SUBROUTINE, BASED
00254 C      ON THE VALUE OF THE RADIAL DISTANCE R:
00255 C
00256       IRP3=R+3
00257       NM=4+30/IRP3
00258       IF (NM.GT.10) NM=10
00259 
00260       K=NM+1
00261       DO 150 N=1,K
00262          P=P*PP
00263          A(N)=P
00264 150      B(N)=P*N
00265 
00266       P=1.
00267       D=0.
00268       BBR=0.
00269       BBT=0.
00270       BBF=0.
00271 
00272       DO 200 M=1,K
00273          IF(M.EQ.1) GOTO 160
00274          MM=M-1
00275          W=X
00276          X=W*CF+Y*SF
00277          Y=Y*CF-W*SF
00278          GOTO 170
00279 160      X=0.
00280          Y=1.
00281 170      Q=P
00282          Z=D
00283          BI=0.
00284          P2=0.
00285          D2=0.
00286          DO 190 N=M,K
00287             AN=A(N)
00288             MN=N*(N-1)/2+M
00289             E=G(MN)
00290             HH=H(MN)
00291             W=E*Y+HH*X
00292             BBR=BBR+B(N)*W*Q
00293             BBT=BBT-AN*W*Z
00294             IF(M.EQ.1) GOTO 180
00295             QQ=Q
00296             IF(S.LT.1.E-5) QQ=Z
00297             BI=BI+AN*(E*X-HH*Y)*QQ
00298 180         XK=REC(MN)
00299             DP=C*Z-S*Q-XK*D2
00300             PM=C*Q-XK*P2
00301             D2=Z
00302             P2=Q
00303             Z=DP
00304 190        Q=PM
00305          D=S*D+C*P
00306          P=S*P
00307          IF(M.EQ.1) GOTO 200
00308          BI=BI*MM
00309          BBF=BBF+BI
00310 200   CONTINUE
00311 C
00312       BR=BBR
00313       BTHETA=BBT
00314       IF(S.LT.1.E-5) GOTO 210
00315       BPHI=BBF/S
00316       RETURN
00317 210   IF(C.LT.0.) BBF=-BBF
00318       BPHI=BBF
00319 
00320       RETURN
00321       END
00322 C
00323 c==========================================================================================
00324 c
00325        SUBROUTINE DIP (XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM,BXGSM,BYGSM,BZGSM)
00326        IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00327 C
00328 C  CALCULATES GSM COMPONENTS OF A GEODIPOLE FIELD WITH THE DIPOLE MOMENT
00329 C  CORRESPONDING TO THE EPOCH, SPECIFIED BY CALLING SUBROUTINE RECALC (SHOULD BE
00330 C  INVOKED BEFORE THE FIRST USE OF THIS ONE AND IN CASE THE DATE/TIME WAS CHANGED).
00331 C
00332 C--INPUT PARAMETERS: XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM - GSM COORDINATES IN RE (1 RE = 6371.2 km)
00333 C
00334 C--OUTPUT PARAMETERS: BXGSM,BYGSM,BZGSM - FIELD COMPONENTS IN GSM SYSTEM, IN NANOTESLA.
00335 C
00336 C  LAST MODIFICATION: MARCH 31, 2003
00337 C
00338 C  AUTHOR: N. A. TSYGANENKO
00339 C
00340       COMMON /GEOPACK1/ AAA(10),SPS,CPS,BBB(23)
00341       COMMON /GEOPACK2/ G(66),H(66),REC(66)
00342 
00343       DIPMOM=SQRT(G(2)**2+G(3)**2+H(3)**2)
00344 
00345       P=XGSM**2
00346       U=ZGSM**2
00347       V=3.*ZGSM*XGSM
00348       T=YGSM**2
00349       Q=DIPMOM/SQRT(P+T+U)**5
00350       BXGSM=Q*((T+U-2.*P)*SPS-V*CPS)
00351       BYGSM=-3.*YGSM*Q*(XGSM*SPS+ZGSM*CPS)
00352       BZGSM=Q*((P+T-2.*U)*CPS-V*SPS)
00353       RETURN
00354       END
00355 
00356 C*******************************************************************
00357 c
00358       SUBROUTINE SUN (IYEAR,IDAY,IHOUR,MINUTE,ISEC,GST,SLONG,SRASN,SDEC)
00359       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00360 C
00361 C  CALCULATES FOUR QUANTITIES NECESSARY FOR COORDINATE TRANSFORMATIONS
00362 C  WHICH DEPEND ON SUN POSITION (AND, HENCE, ON UNIVERSAL TIME AND SEASON)
00363 C
00364 C-------  INPUT PARAMETERS:
00365 C  IYR,IDAY,IHOUR,MIN,ISEC -  YEAR, DAY, AND UNIVERSAL TIME IN HOURS, MINUTES,
00366 C    AND SECONDS  (IDAY=1 CORRESPONDS TO JANUARY 1).
00367 C
00368 C-------  OUTPUT PARAMETERS:
00369 C  GST - GREENWICH MEAN SIDEREAL TIME, SLONG - LONGITUDE ALONG ECLIPTIC
00370 C  SRASN - RIGHT ASCENSION,  SDEC - DECLINATION  OF THE SUN (RADIANS)
00371 C  ORIGINAL VERSION OF THIS SUBROUTINE HAS BEEN COMPILED FROM:
00372 C  RUSSELL, C.T., COSMIC ELECTRODYNAMICS, 1971, V.2, PP.184-196.
00373 C
00374 C  LAST MODIFICATION:  MARCH 31, 2003 (ONLY SOME NOTATION CHANGES)
00375 C
00376 C     ORIGINAL VERSION WRITTEN BY:    Gilbert D. Mead
00377 C
00378       DOUBLE PRECISION DJ,FDAY
00379       DATA RAD/57.295779513/
00380 C
00381       IF(IYEAR.LT.1901.OR.IYEAR.GT.2099) RETURN
00382       FDAY=DFLOAT(IHOUR*3600+MINUTE*60+ISEC)/86400.D0
00383       DJ=365*(IYEAR-1900)+(IYEAR-1901)/4+IDAY-0.5D0+FDAY
00384       T=DJ/36525.
00385       VL=DMOD(279.696678+0.9856473354*DJ,360.D0)
00386       GST=DMOD(279.690983+.9856473354*DJ+360.*FDAY+180.,360.D0)/RAD
00387       G=DMOD(358.475845+0.985600267*DJ,360.D0)/RAD
00388       SLONG=(VL+(1.91946-0.004789*T)*SIN(G)+0.020094*SIN(2.*G))/RAD
00389       IF(SLONG.GT.6.2831853) SLONG=SLONG-6.2831853
00390       IF (SLONG.LT.0.) SLONG=SLONG+6.2831853
00391       OBLIQ=(23.45229-0.0130125*T)/RAD
00392       SOB=SIN(OBLIQ)
00393       SLP=SLONG-9.924E-5
00394 C
00395 C   THE LAST CONSTANT IS A CORRECTION FOR THE ANGULAR ABERRATION  DUE TO
00396 C   THE ORBITAL MOTION OF THE EARTH
00397 C
00398       SIND=SOB*SIN(SLP)
00399       COSD=SQRT(1.-SIND**2)
00400       SC=SIND/COSD
00401       SDEC=ATAN(SC)
00402       SRASN=3.141592654-ATAN2(COS(OBLIQ)/SOB*SC,-COS(SLP)/COSD)
00403       RETURN
00404       END
00405 C
00406 C================================================================================
00407 c
00408       SUBROUTINE SPHCAR (R,THETA,PHI,X,Y,Z,J)
00409       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00410 C
00411 C   CONVERTS SPHERICAL COORDS INTO CARTESIAN ONES AND VICA VERSA
00412 C    (THETA AND PHI IN RADIANS).
00413 C
00414 C                  J>0            J<0
00415 C-----INPUT:   J,R,THETA,PHI     J,X,Y,Z
00416 C----OUTPUT:      X,Y,Z        R,THETA,PHI
00417 C
00418 C  NOTE: AT THE POLES (X=0 AND Y=0) WE ASSUME PHI=0 (WHEN CONVERTING
00419 C        FROM CARTESIAN TO SPHERICAL COORDS, I.E., FOR J<0)
00420 C
00421 C   LAST MOFIFICATION:  APRIL 1, 2003 (ONLY SOME NOTATION CHANGES AND MORE
00422 C                         COMMENTS ADDED)
00423 C
00424 C   AUTHOR:  N. A. TSYGANENKO
00425 C
00426       IF(J.GT.0) GOTO 3
00427       SQ=X**2+Y**2
00428       R=SQRT(SQ+Z**2)
00429       IF (SQ.NE.0.) GOTO 2
00430       PHI=0.
00431       IF (Z.LT.0.) GOTO 1
00432       THETA=0.
00433       RETURN
00434   1   THETA=3.141592654
00435       RETURN
00436   2   SQ=SQRT(SQ)
00437       PHI=ATAN2(Y,X)
00438       THETA=ATAN2(SQ,Z)
00439       IF (PHI.LT.0.) PHI=PHI+6.28318531
00440       RETURN
00441   3   SQ=R*SIN(THETA)
00442       X=SQ*COS(PHI)
00443       Y=SQ*SIN(PHI)
00444       Z=R*COS(THETA)
00445       RETURN
00446       END
00447 C
00448 C===========================================================================
00449 c
00450       SUBROUTINE BSPCAR (THETA,PHI,BR,BTHETA,BPHI,BX,BY,BZ)
00451       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00452 C
00453 C   CALCULATES CARTESIAN FIELD COMPONENTS FROM SPHERICAL ONES
00454 C-----INPUT:   THETA,PHI - SPHERICAL ANGLES OF THE POINT IN RADIANS
00455 C              BR,BTHETA,BPHI -  SPHERICAL COMPONENTS OF THE FIELD
00456 C-----OUTPUT:  BX,BY,BZ - CARTESIAN COMPONENTS OF THE FIELD
00457 C
00458 C   LAST MOFIFICATION:  APRIL 1, 2003 (ONLY SOME NOTATION CHANGES)
00459 C
00460 C   WRITTEN BY:  N. A. TSYGANENKO
00461 C
00462       S=SIN(THETA)
00463       C=COS(THETA)
00464       SF=SIN(PHI)
00465       CF=COS(PHI)
00466       BE=BR*S+BTHETA*C
00467       BX=BE*CF-BPHI*SF
00468       BY=BE*SF+BPHI*CF
00469       BZ=BR*C-BTHETA*S
00470       RETURN
00471       END
00472 c
00473 C==============================================================================
00474 C
00475       SUBROUTINE BCARSP (X,Y,Z,BX,BY,BZ,BR,BTHETA,BPHI)
00476       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00477 C
00478 CALCULATES SPHERICAL FIELD COMPONENTS FROM THOSE IN CARTESIAN SYSTEM
00479 C
00480 C-----INPUT:   X,Y,Z  - CARTESIAN COMPONENTS OF THE POSITION VECTOR
00481 C              BX,BY,BZ - CARTESIAN COMPONENTS OF THE FIELD VECTOR
00482 C-----OUTPUT:  BR,BTHETA,BPHI - SPHERICAL COMPONENTS OF THE FIELD VECTOR
00483 C
00484 C  NOTE: AT THE POLES (THETA=0 OR THETA=PI) WE ASSUME PHI=0,
00485 C        AND HENCE BTHETA=BX, BPHI=BY
00486 C
00487 C   WRITTEN AND ADDED TO THIS PACKAGE:  APRIL 1, 2003,
00488 C   AUTHOR:   N. A. TSYGANENKO
00489 C
00490       RHO2=X**2+Y**2
00491       R=SQRT(RHO2+Z**2)
00492       RHO=SQRT(RHO2)
00493 
00494       IF (RHO.NE.0.) THEN
00495         CPHI=X/RHO
00496         SPHI=Y/RHO
00497        ELSE
00498         CPHI=1.
00499         SPHI=0.
00500       ENDIF
00501 
00502       CT=Z/R
00503       ST=RHO/R
00504 
00505       BR=(X*BX+Y*BY+Z*BZ)/R
00506       BTHETA=(BX*CPHI+BY*SPHI)*CT-BZ*ST
00507       BPHI=BY*CPHI-BX*SPHI
00508 
00509       RETURN
00510       END
00511 C
00512 c=====================================================================================
00513 C
00514       SUBROUTINE RECALC (IYEAR,IDAY,IHOUR,MINUTE,ISEC)
00515       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00516 C
00517 C  1. PREPARES ELEMENTS OF ROTATION MATRICES FOR TRANSFORMATIONS OF VECTORS BETWEEN
00518 C     SEVERAL COORDINATE SYSTEMS, MOST FREQUENTLY USED IN SPACE PHYSICS.
00519 C
00520 C  2. PREPARES COEFFICIENTS USED IN THE CALCULATION OF THE MAIN GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
00521 C      (IGRF MODEL)
00522 C
00523 C  THIS SUBROUTINE SHOULD BE INVOKED BEFORE USING THE FOLLOWING SUBROUTINES:
00524 C    IGRF_GEO, IGRF_GSM, DIP, GEOMAG, GEOGSM, MAGSM, SMGSM, GSMGSE, GEIGEO.
00525 C
00526 C  THERE IS NO NEED TO REPEATEDLY INVOKE RECALC, IF MULTIPLE CALCULATIONS ARE MADE
00527 C    FOR THE SAME DATE AND TIME.
00528 C
00529 C-----INPUT PARAMETERS:
00530 C
00531 C     IYEAR   -  YEAR NUMBER (FOUR DIGITS)
00532 C     IDAY  -  DAY OF YEAR (DAY 1 = JAN 1)
00533 C     IHOUR -  HOUR OF DAY (00 TO 23)
00534 C     MIN   -  MINUTE OF HOUR (00 TO 59)
00535 C     ISEC  -  SECONDS OF MINUTE (00 TO 59)
00536 C
00537 C-----OUTPUT PARAMETERS:   NONE (ALL OUTPUT QUANTITIES ARE PLACED
00538 C                         INTO THE COMMON BLOCKS /GEOPACK1/ AND /GEOPACK2/)
00539 C
00540 C    OTHER SUBROUTINES CALLED BY THIS ONE: SUN
00541 C
00542 C    AUTHOR:  N.A. TSYGANENKO
00543 C    DATE:    DEC.1, 1991
00544 C
00545 C    LAST REVISION: APRIL 3, 2003
00546 c      The code now includes preparation of the model coefficients for the subroutines
00547 c      IGRF and GEOMAG. This eliminates the need for the SAVE statements, used in the
00548 c      old versions, making the codes easier and more compiler-independent.
00549 C
00550       COMMON /GEOPACK1/ ST0,CT0,SL0,CL0,CTCL,STCL,CTSL,STSL,SFI,CFI,SPS,
00551      * CPS,SHI,CHI,HI,PSI,XMUT,A11,A21,A31,A12,A22,A32,A13,A23,A33,DS3,
00552      * CGST,SGST,BA(6)
00553 C
00554 C  THE COMMON BLOCK /GEOPACK1/ CONTAINS ELEMENTS OF THE ROTATION MATRICES AND OTHER
00555 C   PARAMETERS RELATED TO THE COORDINATE TRANSFORMATIONS PERFORMED BY THIS PACKAGE
00556 C
00557       COMMON /GEOPACK2/ G(66),H(66),REC(66)
00558 C
00559 C  THE COMMON BLOCK /GEOPACK2/ CONTAINS COEFFICIENTS OF THE IGRF FIELD MODEL, CALCULATED
00560 C    FOR A GIVEN YEAR AND DAY FROM THEIR STANDARD EPOCH VALUES. THE ARRAY REC CONTAINS
00561 C    COEFFICIENTS USED IN THE RECURSION RELATIONS FOR LEGENDRE ASSOCIATE POLYNOMIALS.
00562 C
00563       DIMENSION G65(66),H65(66),G70(66),H70(66),G75(66),H75(66),G80(66),
00564      * H80(66),G85(66),H85(66),G90(66),H90(66),G95(66),H95(66),G00(66),
00565      * H00(66),DG00(45),DH00(45)
00566 c
00567       DATA G65/0.,-30334.,-2119.,-1662.,2997.,1594.,1297.,-2038.,1292.,
00568      *856.,957.,804.,479.,-390.,252.,-219.,358.,254.,-31.,-157.,-62.,
00569      *45.,61.,8.,-228.,4.,1.,-111.,75.,-57.,4.,13.,-26.,-6.,13.,1.,13.,
00570      *5.,-4.,-14.,0.,8.,-1.,11.,4.,8.,10.,2.,-13.,10.,-1.,-1.,5.,1.,-2.,
00571      *-2.,-3.,2.,-5.,-2.,4.,4.,0.,2.,2.,0./
00572       DATA H65/0.,0.,5776.,0.,-2016.,114.,0.,-404.,240.,-165.,0.,148.,
00573      *-269.,13.,-269.,0.,19.,128.,-126.,-97.,81.,0.,-11.,100.,68.,-32.,
00574      *-8.,-7.,0.,-61.,-27.,-2.,6.,26.,-23.,-12.,0.,7.,-12.,9.,-16.,4.,
00575      *24.,-3.,-17.,0.,-22.,15.,7.,-4.,-5.,10.,10.,-4.,1.,0.,2.,1.,2.,
00576      *6.,-4.,0.,-2.,3.,0.,-6./
00577 c
00578       DATA G70/0.,-30220.,-2068.,-1781.,3000.,1611.,1287.,-2091.,1278.,
00579      *838.,952.,800.,461.,-395.,234.,-216.,359.,262.,-42.,-160.,-56.,
00580      *43.,64.,15.,-212.,2.,3.,-112.,72.,-57.,1.,14.,-22.,-2.,13.,-2.,
00581      *14.,6.,-2.,-13.,-3.,5.,0.,11.,3.,8.,10.,2.,-12.,10.,-1.,0.,3.,
00582      *1.,-1.,-3.,-3.,2.,-5.,-1.,6.,4.,1.,0.,3.,-1./
00583       DATA H70/0.,0.,5737.,0.,-2047.,25.,0.,-366.,251.,-196.,0.,167.,
00584      *-266.,26.,-279.,0.,26.,139.,-139.,-91.,83.,0.,-12.,100.,72.,-37.,
00585      *-6.,1.,0.,-70.,-27.,-4.,8.,23.,-23.,-11.,0.,7.,-15.,6.,-17.,6.,
00586      *21.,-6.,-16.,0.,-21.,16.,6.,-4.,-5.,10.,11.,-2.,1.,0.,1.,1.,3.,
00587      *4.,-4.,0.,-1.,3.,1.,-4./
00588 c
00589       DATA G75/0.,-30100.,-2013.,-1902.,3010.,1632.,1276.,-2144.,1260.,
00590      *830.,946.,791.,438.,-405.,216.,-218.,356.,264.,-59.,-159.,-49.,
00591      *45.,66.,28.,-198.,1.,6.,-111.,71.,-56.,1.,16.,-14.,0.,12.,-5.,
00592      *14.,6.,-1.,-12.,-8.,4.,0.,10.,1.,7.,10.,2.,-12.,10.,-1.,-1.,4.,
00593      *1.,-2.,-3.,-3.,2.,-5.,-2.,5.,4.,1.,0.,3.,-1./
00594       DATA H75/0.,0.,5675.,0.,-2067.,-68.,0.,-333.,262.,-223.,0.,191.,
00595      *-265.,39.,-288.,0.,31.,148.,-152.,-83.,88.,0.,-13.,99.,75.,-41.,
00596      *-4.,11.,0.,-77.,-26.,-5.,10.,22.,-23.,-12.,0.,6.,-16.,4.,-19.,6.,
00597      *18.,-10.,-17.,0.,-21.,16.,7.,-4.,-5.,10.,11.,-3.,1.,0.,1.,1.,3.,
00598      *4.,-4.,-1.,-1.,3.,1.,-5./
00599 c
00600       DATA G80/0.,-29992.,-1956.,-1997.,3027.,1663.,1281.,-2180.,1251.,
00601      *833.,938.,782.,398.,-419.,199.,-218.,357.,261.,-74.,-162.,-48.,
00602      *48.,66.,42.,-192.,4.,14.,-108.,72.,-59.,2.,21.,-12.,1.,11.,-2.,
00603      *18.,6.,0.,-11.,-7.,4.,3.,6.,-1.,5.,10.,1.,-12.,9.,-3.,-1.,7.,2.,
00604      *-5.,-4.,-4.,2.,-5.,-2.,5.,3.,1.,2.,3.,0./
00605       DATA H80/0.,0.,5604.,0.,-2129.,-200.,0.,-336.,271.,-252.,0.,212.,
00606      *-257.,53.,-297.,0.,46.,150.,-151.,-78.,92.,0.,-15.,93.,71.,-43.,
00607      *-2.,17.,0.,-82.,-27.,-5.,16.,18.,-23.,-10.,0.,7.,-18.,4.,-22.,9.,
00608      *16.,-13.,-15.,0.,-21.,16.,9.,-5.,-6.,9.,10.,-6.,2.,0.,1.,0.,3.,
00609      *6.,-4.,0.,-1.,4.,0.,-6./
00610 c
00611       DATA G85/0.,-29873.,-1905.,-2072.,3044.,1687.,1296.,-2208.,1247.,
00612      *829.,936.,780.,361.,-424.,170.,-214.,355.,253.,-93.,-164.,-46.,
00613      *53.,65.,51.,-185.,4.,16.,-102.,74.,-62.,3.,24.,-6.,4.,10.,0.,21.,
00614      *6.,0.,-11.,-9.,4.,4.,4.,-4.,5.,10.,1.,-12.,9.,-3.,-1.,7.,1.,-5.,
00615      *-4.,-4.,3.,-5.,-2.,5.,3.,1.,2.,3.,0./
00616       DATA H85/0.,0.,5500.,0.,-2197.,-306.,0.,-310.,284.,-297.,0.,232.,
00617      *-249.,69.,-297.,0.,47.,150.,-154.,-75.,95.,0.,-16.,88.,69.,-48.,
00618      *-1.,21.,0.,-83.,-27.,-2.,20.,17.,-23.,-7.,0.,8.,-19.,5.,-23.,11.,
00619      *14.,-15.,-11.,0.,-21.,15.,9.,-6.,-6.,9.,9.,-7.,2.,0.,1.,0.,3.,
00620      *6.,-4.,0.,-1.,4.,0.,-6./
00621 c
00622       DATA G90/0., -29775.,  -1848.,  -2131.,   3059.,   1686.,   1314.,
00623      *     -2239.,   1248.,    802.,    939.,    780.,    325.,   -423.,
00624      *       141.,   -214.,    353.,    245.,   -109.,   -165.,    -36.,
00625      *        61.,     65.,     59.,   -178.,      3.,     18.,    -96.,
00626      *        77.,    -64.,      2.,     26.,     -1.,      5.,      9.,
00627      *         0.,     23.,      5.,     -1.,    -10.,    -12.,      3.,
00628      *         4.,      2.,     -6.,      4.,      9.,      1.,    -12.,
00629      *         9.,     -4.,     -2.,      7.,      1.,     -6.,     -3.,
00630      *        -4.,      2.,     -5.,     -2.,      4.,      3.,      1.,
00631      *         3.,      3.,      0./
00632 
00633       DATA H90/0.,      0.,   5406.,      0.,  -2279.,   -373.,      0.,
00634      *      -284.,    293.,   -352.,      0.,    247.,   -240.,     84.,
00635      *      -299.,      0.,     46.,    154.,   -153.,    -69.,     97.,
00636      *         0.,    -16.,     82.,     69.,    -52.,      1.,     24.,
00637      *         0.,    -80.,    -26.,      0.,     21.,     17.,    -23.,
00638      *        -4.,      0.,     10.,    -19.,      6.,    -22.,     12.,
00639      *        12.,    -16.,    -10.,      0.,    -20.,     15.,     11.,
00640      *        -7.,     -7.,      9.,      8.,     -7.,      2.,      0.,
00641      *         2.,      1.,      3.,      6.,     -4.,      0.,     -2.,
00642      *         3.,     -1.,     -6./
00643 
00644       DATA G95/0., -29682.,  -1789.,  -2197.,   3074.,   1685.,   1329.,
00645      *     -2268.,   1249.,    769.,    941.,    782.,    291.,   -421.,
00646      *       116.,   -210.,    352.,    237.,   -122.,   -167.,    -26.,
00647      *        66.,     64.,     65.,   -172.,      2.,     17.,    -94.,
00648      *        78.,    -67.,      1.,     29.,      4.,      8.,     10.,
00649      *        -2.,     24.,      4.,     -1.,     -9.,    -14.,      4.,
00650      *         5.,      0.,     -7.,      4.,      9.,      1.,    -12.,
00651      *         9.,     -4.,     -2.,      7.,      0.,     -6.,     -3.,
00652      *        -4.,      2.,     -5.,     -2.,      4.,      3.,      1.,
00653      *         3.,      3.,      0./
00654 
00655       DATA H95/0.,      0.,   5318.,      0.,  -2356.,   -425.,      0.,
00656      *      -263.,    302.,   -406.,      0.,    262.,   -232.,     98.,
00657      *      -301.,      0.,     44.,    157.,   -152.,    -64.,     99.,
00658      *         0.,    -16.,     77.,     67.,    -57.,      4.,     28.,
00659      *         0.,    -77.,    -25.,      3.,     22.,     16.,    -23.,
00660      *        -3.,      0.,     12.,    -20.,      7.,    -21.,     12.,
00661      *        10.,    -17.,    -10.,      0.,    -19.,     15.,     11.,
00662      *        -7.,     -7.,      9.,      7.,     -8.,      1.,      0.,
00663      *         2.,      1.,      3.,      6.,     -4.,      0.,     -2.,
00664      *         3.,     -1.,     -6./
00665 
00666       DATA G00/0., -29615.,  -1728.,  -2267.,   3072.,   1672.,   1341.,
00667      *     -2290.,   1253.,    715.,    935.,    787.,    251.,   -405.,
00668      *       110.,   -217.,    351.,    222.,   -131.,   -169.,    -12.,
00669      *        72.,     68.,     74.,   -161.,     -5.,     17.,    -91.,
00670      *        79.,    -74.,      0.,     33.,      9.,      7.,      8.,
00671      *        -2.,     25.,      6.,     -9.,     -8.,    -17.,      9.,
00672      *         7.,     -8.,     -7.,      5.,      9.,      3.,    - 8.,
00673      *         6.,     -9.,     -2.,      9.,     -4.,     -8.,     -2.,
00674      *        -6.,      2.,     -3.,      0.,      4.,      1.,      2.,
00675      *         4.,      0.,     -1./
00676 
00677 
00678       DATA H00/0.,      0.,   5186.,      0.,  -2478.,   -458.,      0.,
00679      *      -227.,    296.,   -492.,      0.,    272.,   -232.,    119.,
00680      *      -304.,      0.,     44.,    172.,   -134.,    -40.,    107.,
00681      *         0.,    -17.,     64.,     65.,    -61.,      1.,     44.,
00682      *         0.,    -65.,    -24.,      6.,     24.,     15.,    -25.,
00683      *        -6.,      0.,     12.,    -22.,      8.,    -21.,     15.,
00684      *         9.,    -16.,     -3.,      0.,    -20.,     13.,     12.,
00685      *        -6.,     -8.,      9.,      4.,     -8.,      5.,      0.,
00686      *         1.,      0.,      4.,      5.,     -6.,     -1.,     -3.,
00687      *         0.,     -2.,     -8./
00688 
00689 
00690       DATA DG00/0.0,  14.6,    10.7,   -12.4,     1.1,    -1.1,     0.7,
00691      *         -5.4,   0.9,    -7.7,    -1.3,     1.6,    -7.3,     2.9,
00692      *         -3.2,   0.0,    -0.7,    -2.1,    -2.8,    -0.8,     2.5,
00693      *          1.0,  -0.4,     0.9,     2.0,    -0.6,    -0.3,     1.2,
00694      *         -0.4,  -0.4,    -0.3,     1.1,     1.1,    -0.2,     0.6,
00695      *         -0.9,  -0.3,     0.2,    -0.3,     0.4,    -1.0,     0.3,
00696      *         -0.5,  -0.7,    -0.4/
00697 
00698       DATA DH00/0.0,   0.0,   -22.5,     0.0,   -20.6,    -9.6,     0.0,
00699      *          6.0,  -0.1,   -14.2,     0.0,     2.1,     1.3,     5.0,
00700      *          0.3,   0.0,    -0.1,     0.6,     1.7,     1.9,     0.1,
00701      *          0.0,  -0.2,    -1.4,     0.0,    -0.8,     0.0,     0.9,
00702      *          0.0,   1.1,     0.0,     0.3,    -0.1,    -0.6,    -0.7,
00703      *          0.2,   0.0,     0.1,     0.0,     0.0,     0.3,     0.6,
00704      *         -0.4,   0.3,     0.7/
00705 C
00706 C
00707       IY=IYEAR
00708 C
00709 C  WE ARE RESTRICTED BY THE INTERVAL 1965-2005,
00710 C  FOR WHICH THE IGRF COEFFICIENTS ARE KNOWN; IF IYEAR IS OUTSIDE THIS INTERVAL,
00711 C  THE SUBROUTINE USES THE NEAREST LIMITING VALUE AND PRINTS A WARNING:
00712 C
00713       IF(IY.LT.1965) THEN
00714        IY=1965
00715        WRITE (*,10) IYEAR,IY
00716       ENDIF
00717 
00718       IF(IY.GT.2005) THEN
00719        IY=2005
00720 C       WRITE (*,10) IYEAR,IY
00721       ENDIF
00722 
00723 C
00724 C  CALCULATE THE ARRAY REC, CONTAINING COEFFICIENTS FOR THE RECURSION RELATIONS,
00725 C  USED IN THE IGRF SUBROUTINE FOR CALCULATING THE ASSOCIATE LEGENDRE POLYNOMIALS
00726 C  AND THEIR DERIVATIVES:
00727 c
00728       DO 20 N=1,11
00729          N2=2*N-1
00730          N2=N2*(N2-2)
00731          DO 20 M=1,N
00732             MN=N*(N-1)/2+M
00733 20    REC(MN)=FLOAT((N-M)*(N+M-2))/FLOAT(N2)
00734 C
00735       IF (IY.LT.1970) GOTO 50          !INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1965 - 1970
00736       IF (IY.LT.1975) GOTO 60          !INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1970 - 1975
00737       IF (IY.LT.1980) GOTO 70          !INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1975 - 1980
00738       IF (IY.LT.1985) GOTO 80          !INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1980 - 1985
00739       IF (IY.LT.1990) GOTO 90          !INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1985 - 1990
00740       IF (IY.LT.1995) GOTO 100         !INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1990 - 1995
00741       IF (IY.LT.2000) GOTO 110         !INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1995 - 2000
00742 C
00743 C       EXTRAPOLATE BEYOND 2000:
00744 C
00745 
00746       DT=FLOAT(IY)+FLOAT(IDAY-1)/365.25-2000.
00747       DO 40 N=1,66
00748          G(N)=G00(N)
00749          H(N)=H00(N)
00750          IF (N.GT.45) GOTO 40
00751          G(N)=G(N)+DG00(N)*DT
00752          H(N)=H(N)+DH00(N)*DT
00753 40    CONTINUE
00754       GOTO 300
00755 C
00756 C       INTERPOLATE BETWEEEN 1965 - 1970:
00757 C
00758 50    F2=(FLOAT(IY)+FLOAT(IDAY-1)/365.25-1965)/5.
00759       F1=1.-F2
00760       DO 55 N=1,66
00761          G(N)=G65(N)*F1+G70(N)*F2
00762 55       H(N)=H65(N)*F1+H70(N)*F2
00763       GOTO 300
00764 C
00765 C       INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1970 - 1975:
00766 C
00767 60    F2=(FLOAT(IY)+FLOAT(IDAY-1)/365.25-1970)/5.
00768       F1=1.-F2
00769       DO 65 N=1,66
00770          G(N)=G70(N)*F1+G75(N)*F2
00771 65       H(N)=H70(N)*F1+H75(N)*F2
00772       GOTO 300
00773 C
00774 C       INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1975 - 1980:
00775 C
00776 70    F2=(FLOAT(IY)+FLOAT(IDAY-1)/365.25-1975)/5.
00777       F1=1.-F2
00778       DO 75 N=1,66
00779          G(N)=G75(N)*F1+G80(N)*F2
00780 75       H(N)=H75(N)*F1+H80(N)*F2
00781       GOTO 300
00782 C
00783 C       INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1980 - 1985:
00784 C
00785 80    F2=(FLOAT(IY)+FLOAT(IDAY-1)/365.25-1980)/5.
00786       F1=1.-F2
00787       DO 85 N=1,66
00788          G(N)=G80(N)*F1+G85(N)*F2
00789 85       H(N)=H80(N)*F1+H85(N)*F2
00790       GOTO 300
00791 C
00792 C       INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1985 - 1990:
00793 C
00794 90    F2=(FLOAT(IY)+FLOAT(IDAY-1)/365.25-1985)/5.
00795       F1=1.-F2
00796       DO 95 N=1,66
00797          G(N)=G85(N)*F1+G90(N)*F2
00798 95       H(N)=H85(N)*F1+H90(N)*F2
00799       GOTO 300
00800 C
00801 C       INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1990 - 1995:
00802 C
00803 100   F2=(FLOAT(IY)+FLOAT(IDAY-1)/365.25-1990)/5.
00804       F1=1.-F2
00805       DO 105 N=1,66
00806          G(N)=G90(N)*F1+G95(N)*F2
00807 105      H(N)=H90(N)*F1+H95(N)*F2
00808       GOTO 300
00809 C
00810 C       INTERPOLATE BETWEEN 1995 - 2000:
00811 C
00812 110   F2=(FLOAT(IY)+FLOAT(IDAY-1)/365.25-1995)/5.
00813       F1=1.-F2
00814       DO 115 N=1,66
00815          G(N)=G95(N)*F1+G00(N)*F2
00816 115      H(N)=H95(N)*F1+H00(N)*F2
00817       GOTO 300
00818 C
00819 C   COEFFICIENTS FOR A GIVEN YEAR HAVE BEEN CALCULATED; NOW MULTIPLY
00820 C   THEM BY SCHMIDT NORMALIZATION FACTORS:
00821 C
00822 300   S=1.
00823       DO 120 N=2,11
00824          MN=N*(N-1)/2+1
00825          S=S*FLOAT(2*N-3)/FLOAT(N-1)
00826          G(MN)=G(MN)*S
00827          H(MN)=H(MN)*S
00828          P=S
00829          DO 120 M=2,N
00830             AA=1.
00831             IF (M.EQ.2) AA=2.
00832             P=P*SQRT(AA*FLOAT(N-M+1)/FLOAT(N+M-2))
00833             MNN=MN+M-1
00834             G(MNN)=G(MNN)*P
00835 120         H(MNN)=H(MNN)*P
00836 
00837            G10=-G(2)
00838            G11= G(3)
00839            H11= H(3)
00840 C
00841 C  NOW CALCULATE THE COMPONENTS OF THE UNIT VECTOR EzMAG IN GEO COORD.SYSTEM:
00842 C   SIN(TETA0)*COS(LAMBDA0), SIN(TETA0)*SIN(LAMBDA0), AND COS(TETA0)
00843 C         ST0 * CL0                ST0 * SL0                CT0
00844 C
00845       SQ=G11**2+H11**2
00846       SQQ=SQRT(SQ)
00847       SQR=SQRT(G10**2+SQ)
00848       SL0=-H11/SQQ
00849       CL0=-G11/SQQ
00850       ST0=SQQ/SQR
00851       CT0=G10/SQR
00852       STCL=ST0*CL0
00853       STSL=ST0*SL0
00854       CTSL=CT0*SL0
00855       CTCL=CT0*CL0
00856 C
00857       CALL SUN (IY,IDAY,IHOUR,MINUTE,ISEC,GST,SLONG,SRASN,SDEC)
00858 C
00859 C  S1,S2, AND S3 ARE THE COMPONENTS OF THE UNIT VECTOR EXGSM=EXGSE IN THE
00860 C   SYSTEM GEI POINTING FROM THE EARTH'S CENTER TO THE SUN:
00861 C
00862       S1=COS(SRASN)*COS(SDEC)
00863       S2=SIN(SRASN)*COS(SDEC)
00864       S3=SIN(SDEC)
00865       CGST=COS(GST)
00866       SGST=SIN(GST)
00867 C
00868 C  DIP1, DIP2, AND DIP3 ARE THE COMPONENTS OF THE UNIT VECTOR EZSM=EZMAG
00869 C   IN THE SYSTEM GEI:
00870 C
00871       DIP1=STCL*CGST-STSL*SGST
00872       DIP2=STCL*SGST+STSL*CGST
00873       DIP3=CT0
00874 C
00875 C  NOW CALCULATE THE COMPONENTS OF THE UNIT VECTOR EYGSM IN THE SYSTEM GEI
00876 C   BY TAKING THE VECTOR PRODUCT D x S AND NORMALIZING IT TO UNIT LENGTH:
00877 C
00878       Y1=DIP2*S3-DIP3*S2
00879       Y2=DIP3*S1-DIP1*S3
00880       Y3=DIP1*S2-DIP2*S1
00881       Y=SQRT(Y1*Y1+Y2*Y2+Y3*Y3)
00882       Y1=Y1/Y
00883       Y2=Y2/Y
00884       Y3=Y3/Y
00885 C
00886 C   THEN IN THE GEI SYSTEM THE UNIT VECTOR Z = EZGSM = EXGSM x EYGSM = S x Y
00887 C    HAS THE COMPONENTS:
00888 C
00889       Z1=S2*Y3-S3*Y2
00890       Z2=S3*Y1-S1*Y3
00891       Z3=S1*Y2-S2*Y1
00892 C
00893 C    THE VECTOR EZGSE (HERE DZ) IN GEI HAS THE COMPONENTS (0,-SIN(DELTA),
00894 C     COS(DELTA)) = (0.,-0.397823,0.917462); HERE DELTA = 23.44214 DEG FOR
00895 C   THE EPOCH 1978 (SEE THE BOOK BY GUREVICH OR OTHER ASTRONOMICAL HANDBOOKS).
00896 C    HERE THE MOST ACCURATE TIME-DEPENDENT FORMULA IS USED:
00897 C
00898       DJ=FLOAT(365*(IY-1900)+(IY-1901)/4 +IDAY)
00899      * -0.5+FLOAT(IHOUR*3600+MINUTE*60+ISEC)/86400.
00900       T=DJ/36525.
00901       OBLIQ=(23.45229-0.0130125*T)/57.2957795
00902       DZ1=0.
00903       DZ2=-SIN(OBLIQ)
00904       DZ3=COS(OBLIQ)
00905 C
00906 C  THEN THE UNIT VECTOR EYGSE IN GEI SYSTEM IS THE VECTOR PRODUCT DZ x S :
00907 C
00908       DY1=DZ2*S3-DZ3*S2
00909       DY2=DZ3*S1-DZ1*S3
00910       DY3=DZ1*S2-DZ2*S1
00911 C
00912 C   THE ELEMENTS OF THE MATRIX GSE TO GSM ARE THE SCALAR PRODUCTS:
00913 C   CHI=EM22=(EYGSM,EYGSE), SHI=EM23=(EYGSM,EZGSE), EM32=(EZGSM,EYGSE)=-EM23,
00914 C     AND EM33=(EZGSM,EZGSE)=EM22
00915 C
00916       CHI=Y1*DY1+Y2*DY2+Y3*DY3
00917       SHI=Y1*DZ1+Y2*DZ2+Y3*DZ3
00918       HI=ASIN(SHI)
00919 C
00920 C    TILT ANGLE: PSI=ARCSIN(DIP,EXGSM)
00921 C
00922       SPS=DIP1*S1+DIP2*S2+DIP3*S3
00923       CPS=SQRT(1.-SPS**2)
00924       PSI=ASIN(SPS)
00925 C      WRITE(*,*) 'PSI=', PSI
00926 C
00927 C    THE ELEMENTS OF THE MATRIX MAG TO SM ARE THE SCALAR PRODUCTS:
00928 C CFI=GM22=(EYSM,EYMAG), SFI=GM23=(EYSM,EXMAG); THEY CAN BE DERIVED AS FOLLOWS:
00929 C
00930 C IN GEO THE VECTORS EXMAG AND EYMAG HAVE THE COMPONENTS (CT0*CL0,CT0*SL0,-ST0)
00931 C  AND (-SL0,CL0,0), RESPECTIVELY.    HENCE, IN GEI THE COMPONENTS ARE:
00932 C  EXMAG:    CT0*CL0*COS(GST)-CT0*SL0*SIN(GST)
00933 C            CT0*CL0*SIN(GST)+CT0*SL0*COS(GST)
00934 C            -ST0
00935 C  EYMAG:    -SL0*COS(GST)-CL0*SIN(GST)
00936 C            -SL0*SIN(GST)+CL0*COS(GST)
00937 C             0
00938 C  THE COMPONENTS OF EYSM IN GEI WERE FOUND ABOVE AS Y1, Y2, AND Y3;
00939 C  NOW WE ONLY HAVE TO COMBINE THE QUANTITIES INTO SCALAR PRODUCTS:
00940 C
00941       EXMAGX=CT0*(CL0*CGST-SL0*SGST)
00942       EXMAGY=CT0*(CL0*SGST+SL0*CGST)
00943       EXMAGZ=-ST0
00944       EYMAGX=-(SL0*CGST+CL0*SGST)
00945       EYMAGY=-(SL0*SGST-CL0*CGST)
00946       CFI=Y1*EYMAGX+Y2*EYMAGY
00947       SFI=Y1*EXMAGX+Y2*EXMAGY+Y3*EXMAGZ
00948 C
00949       XMUT=(ATAN2(SFI,CFI)+3.1415926536)*3.8197186342
00950 C
00951 C  THE ELEMENTS OF THE MATRIX GEO TO GSM ARE THE SCALAR PRODUCTS:
00952 C
00953 C   A11=(EXGEO,EXGSM), A12=(EYGEO,EXGSM), A13=(EZGEO,EXGSM),
00954 C   A21=(EXGEO,EYGSM), A22=(EYGEO,EYGSM), A23=(EZGEO,EYGSM),
00955 C   A31=(EXGEO,EZGSM), A32=(EYGEO,EZGSM), A33=(EZGEO,EZGSM),
00956 C
00957 C   ALL THE UNIT VECTORS IN BRACKETS ARE ALREADY DEFINED IN GEI:
00958 C
00959 C  EXGEO=(CGST,SGST,0), EYGEO=(-SGST,CGST,0), EZGEO=(0,0,1)
00960 C  EXGSM=(S1,S2,S3),  EYGSM=(Y1,Y2,Y3),   EZGSM=(Z1,Z2,Z3)
00961 C                                                           AND  THEREFORE:
00962 C
00963       A11=S1*CGST+S2*SGST
00964       A12=-S1*SGST+S2*CGST
00965       A13=S3
00966       A21=Y1*CGST+Y2*SGST
00967       A22=-Y1*SGST+Y2*CGST
00968       A23=Y3
00969       A31=Z1*CGST+Z2*SGST
00970       A32=-Z1*SGST+Z2*CGST
00971       A33=Z3
00972 C
00973  10   FORMAT(//1X,
00974      *'**** RECALC WARNS: YEAR IS OUT OF INTERVAL 1965-2005: IYEAR=',I4,
00975      * /,6X,'CALCULATIONS WILL BE DONE FOR IYEAR=',I4,/)
00976       RETURN
00977       END
00978 c
00979 c====================================================================
00980 C
00981       SUBROUTINE GEOMAG (XGEO,YGEO,ZGEO,XMAG,YMAG,ZMAG,J)
00982       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
00983 C
00984 C    CONVERTS GEOGRAPHIC (GEO) TO DIPOLE (MAG) COORDINATES OR VICA VERSA.
00985 C
00986 C                    J>0                       J<0
00987 C-----INPUT:  J,XGEO,YGEO,ZGEO           J,XMAG,YMAG,ZMAG
00988 C-----OUTPUT:    XMAG,YMAG,ZMAG           XGEO,YGEO,ZGEO
00989 C
00990 C
00991 C  ATTENTION:  SUBROUTINE  RECALC  MUST BE INVOKED BEFORE GEOMAG IN TWO CASES:
00992 C     /A/  BEFORE THE FIRST TRANSFORMATION OF COORDINATES
00993 C     /B/  IF THE VALUES OF IYEAR AND/OR IDAY HAVE BEEN CHANGED
00994 C
00995 C
00996 C   LAST MOFIFICATION:  MARCH 30, 2003 (INVOCATION OF RECALC INSIDE THIS S/R WAS REMOVED)
00997 C
00998 C   AUTHOR:  N. A. TSYGANENKO
00999 C
01000       COMMON /GEOPACK1/ ST0,CT0,SL0,CL0,CTCL,STCL,CTSL,STSL,AB(19),BB(8)
01001 
01002       IF(J.GT.0) THEN
01003        XMAG=XGEO*CTCL+YGEO*CTSL-ZGEO*ST0
01004        YMAG=YGEO*CL0-XGEO*SL0
01005        ZMAG=XGEO*STCL+YGEO*STSL+ZGEO*CT0
01006       ELSE
01007        XGEO=XMAG*CTCL-YMAG*SL0+ZMAG*STCL
01008        YGEO=XMAG*CTSL+YMAG*CL0+ZMAG*STSL
01009        ZGEO=ZMAG*CT0-XMAG*ST0
01010       ENDIF
01011 
01012       RETURN
01013       END
01014 c
01015 c=========================================================================================
01016 c
01017       SUBROUTINE GEIGEO (XGEI,YGEI,ZGEI,XGEO,YGEO,ZGEO,J)
01018       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01019 C
01020 C   CONVERTS EQUATORIAL INERTIAL (GEI) TO GEOGRAPHICAL (GEO) COORDS
01021 C   OR VICA VERSA.
01022 C                    J>0                J<0
01023 C----INPUT:  J,XGEI,YGEI,ZGEI    J,XGEO,YGEO,ZGEO
01024 C----OUTPUT:   XGEO,YGEO,ZGEO      XGEI,YGEI,ZGEI
01025 C
01026 C  ATTENTION:  SUBROUTINE  RECALC  MUST BE INVOKED BEFORE GEIGEO IN TWO CASES:
01027 C     /A/  BEFORE THE FIRST TRANSFORMATION OF COORDINATES
01028 C     /B/  IF THE CURRENT VALUES OF IYEAR,IDAY,IHOUR,MIN,ISEC HAVE BEEN CHANGED
01029 C
01030 C     LAST MODIFICATION:  MARCH 31, 2003
01031 
01032 C     AUTHOR:  N. A. TSYGANENKO
01033 C
01034       COMMON /GEOPACK1/ A(27),CGST,SGST,B(6)
01035 C
01036       IF(J.GT.0) THEN
01037        XGEO=XGEI*CGST+YGEI*SGST
01038        YGEO=YGEI*CGST-XGEI*SGST
01039        ZGEO=ZGEI
01040       ELSE
01041        XGEI=XGEO*CGST-YGEO*SGST
01042        YGEI=YGEO*CGST+XGEO*SGST
01043        ZGEI=ZGEO
01044       ENDIF
01045 
01046       RETURN
01047       END
01048 C
01049 C=======================================================================================
01050 C
01051       SUBROUTINE MAGSM (XMAG,YMAG,ZMAG,XSM,YSM,ZSM,J)
01052       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01053 C
01054 C  CONVERTS DIPOLE (MAG) TO SOLAR MAGNETIC (SM) COORDINATES OR VICA VERSA
01055 C
01056 C                    J>0              J<0
01057 C----INPUT: J,XMAG,YMAG,ZMAG     J,XSM,YSM,ZSM
01058 C----OUTPUT:    XSM,YSM,ZSM       XMAG,YMAG,ZMAG
01059 C
01060 C  ATTENTION:  SUBROUTINE  RECALC  MUST BE INVOKED BEFORE MAGSM IN TWO CASES:
01061 C     /A/  BEFORE THE FIRST TRANSFORMATION OF COORDINATES
01062 C     /B/  IF THE VALUES OF IYEAR,IDAY,IHOUR,MIN,ISEC HAVE BEEN CHANGED
01063 C
01064 C     LAST MODIFICATION:  MARCH 31, 2003
01065 C
01066 C     AUTHOR:  N. A. TSYGANENKO
01067 C
01068       COMMON /GEOPACK1/ A(8),SFI,CFI,B(7),AB(10),BA(8)
01069 C
01070       IF (J.GT.0) THEN
01071        XSM=XMAG*CFI-YMAG*SFI
01072        YSM=XMAG*SFI+YMAG*CFI
01073        ZSM=ZMAG
01074       ELSE
01075        XMAG=XSM*CFI+YSM*SFI
01076        YMAG=YSM*CFI-XSM*SFI
01077        ZMAG=ZSM
01078       ENDIF
01079 
01080       RETURN
01081       END
01082 C
01083 C=======================================================================================
01084 C
01085        SUBROUTINE GSMGSE (XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM,XGSE,YGSE,ZGSE,J)
01086       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01087 C
01088 C CONVERTS GEOCENTRIC SOLAR MAGNETOSPHERIC (GSM) COORDS TO SOLAR ECLIPTIC (GSE) ONES
01089 C   OR VICA VERSA.
01090 C                    J>0                J<0
01091 C-----INPUT: J,XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM    J,XGSE,YGSE,ZGSE
01092 C----OUTPUT:   XGSE,YGSE,ZGSE      XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM
01093 C
01094 C  ATTENTION:  SUBROUTINE  RECALC  MUST BE INVOKED BEFORE GSMGSE IN TWO CASES:
01095 C     /A/  BEFORE THE FIRST TRANSFORMATION OF COORDINATES
01096 C     /B/  IF THE VALUES OF IYEAR,IDAY,IHOUR,MIN,ISEC HAVE BEEN CHANGED
01097 C
01098 C     LAST MODIFICATION:  MARCH 31, 2003
01099 C
01100 C     AUTHOR:  N. A. TSYGANENKO
01101 C
01102       COMMON /GEOPACK1/ A(12),SHI,CHI,AB(13),BA(8)
01103 C
01104       IF (J.GT.0) THEN
01105        XGSE=XGSM
01106        YGSE=YGSM*CHI-ZGSM*SHI
01107        ZGSE=YGSM*SHI+ZGSM*CHI
01108       ELSE
01109        XGSM=XGSE
01110        YGSM=YGSE*CHI+ZGSE*SHI
01111        ZGSM=ZGSE*CHI-YGSE*SHI
01112       ENDIF
01113 
01114       RETURN
01115       END
01116 C
01117 C=====================================================================================
01118 C
01119        SUBROUTINE SMGSM (XSM,YSM,ZSM,XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM,J)
01120        IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01121 C
01122 C CONVERTS SOLAR MAGNETIC (SM) TO GEOCENTRIC SOLAR MAGNETOSPHERIC
01123 C   (GSM) COORDINATES OR VICA VERSA.
01124 C                  J>0                 J<0
01125 C-----INPUT: J,XSM,YSM,ZSM        J,XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM
01126 C----OUTPUT:  XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM       XSM,YSM,ZSM
01127 C
01128 C  ATTENTION:  SUBROUTINE RECALC  MUST BE INVOKED BEFORE SMGSM IN TWO CASES:
01129 C     /A/  BEFORE THE FIRST TRANSFORMATION OF COORDINATES
01130 C     /B/  IF THE VALUES OF IYEAR,IDAY,IHOUR,MIN,ISEC HAVE BEEN CHANGED
01131 C
01132 C     LAST MODIFICATION:  MARCH 31, 2003
01133 C
01134 C     AUTHOR:  N. A. TSYGANENKO
01135 C
01136       COMMON /GEOPACK1/ A(10),SPS,CPS,B(15),AB(8)
01137 
01138       IF (J.GT.0) THEN
01139        XGSM=XSM*CPS+ZSM*SPS
01140        YGSM=YSM
01141        ZGSM=ZSM*CPS-XSM*SPS
01142       ELSE
01143        XSM=XGSM*CPS-ZGSM*SPS
01144        YSM=YGSM
01145        ZSM=XGSM*SPS+ZGSM*CPS
01146       ENDIF
01147 
01148       RETURN
01149       END
01150 C
01151 C==========================================================================================
01152 C
01153       SUBROUTINE GEOGSM (XGEO,YGEO,ZGEO,XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM,J)
01154       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01155 C
01156 C CONVERTS GEOGRAPHIC (GEO) TO GEOCENTRIC SOLAR MAGNETOSPHERIC (GSM) COORDINATES
01157 C   OR VICA VERSA.
01158 C
01159 C                   J>0                   J<0
01160 C----- INPUT:  J,XGEO,YGEO,ZGEO    J,XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM
01161 C---- OUTPUT:    XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM      XGEO,YGEO,ZGEO
01162 C
01163 C  ATTENTION:  SUBROUTINE  RECALC  MUST BE INVOKED BEFORE GEOGSM IN TWO CASES:
01164 C     /A/  BEFORE THE FIRST TRANSFORMATION OF COORDINATES
01165 C     /B/  IF THE VALUES OF IYEAR,IDAY,IHOUR,MIN,ISEC  HAVE BEEN CHANGED
01166 C
01167 C     LAST MODIFICATION: MARCH 31, 2003
01168 C
01169 C     AUTHOR:  N. A. TSYGANENKO
01170 C
01171       COMMON /GEOPACK1/AA(17),A11,A21,A31,A12,A22,A32,A13,A23,A33,D,B(8)
01172 C
01173       IF (J.GT.0) THEN
01174        XGSM=A11*XGEO+A12*YGEO+A13*ZGEO
01175        YGSM=A21*XGEO+A22*YGEO+A23*ZGEO
01176        ZGSM=A31*XGEO+A32*YGEO+A33*ZGEO
01177       ELSE
01178        XGEO=A11*XGSM+A21*YGSM+A31*ZGSM
01179        YGEO=A12*XGSM+A22*YGSM+A32*ZGSM
01180        ZGEO=A13*XGSM+A23*YGSM+A33*ZGSM
01181       ENDIF
01182 
01183       RETURN
01184       END
01185 C
01186 C=====================================================================================
01187 C
01188       SUBROUTINE RHAND (X,Y,Z,R1,R2,R3,IOPT,PARMOD,EXNAME,INNAME)
01189       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01190 C
01191 C  CALCULATES THE COMPONENTS OF THE RIGHT HAND SIDE VECTOR IN THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
01192 C    LINE EQUATION  (a subsidiary subroutine for the subroutine STEP)
01193 C
01194 C     LAST MODIFICATION:  MARCH 31, 2003
01195 C
01196 C     AUTHOR:  N. A. TSYGANENKO
01197 C
01198       DIMENSION PARMOD(10)
01199 C
01200 C     EXNAME AND INNAME ARE NAMES OF SUBROUTINES FOR THE EXTERNAL AND INTERNAL
01201 C     PARTS OF THE TOTAL FIELD
01202 C
01203       COMMON /GEOPACK1/ A(15),PSI,AA(10),DS3,BB(8)
01204 
01205       CALL EXNAME (IOPT,PARMOD,PSI,X,Y,Z,BXGSM,BYGSM,BZGSM)
01206       CALL INNAME (X,Y,Z,HXGSM,HYGSM,HZGSM)
01207 
01208       BX=BXGSM+HXGSM
01209       BY=BYGSM+HYGSM
01210       BZ=BZGSM+HZGSM
01211       B=DS3/SQRT(BX**2+BY**2+BZ**2)
01212       R1=BX*B
01213       R2=BY*B
01214       R3=BZ*B
01215       RETURN
01216       END
01217 C
01218 C===================================================================================
01219 C
01220       SUBROUTINE STEP (X,Y,Z,DS,ERRIN,IOPT,PARMOD,EXNAME,INNAME)
01221       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01222 C
01223 C   RE-CALCULATES {X,Y,Z}, MAKING A STEP ALONG A FIELD LINE.
01224 C   DS IS THE STEP SIZE, ERRIN IS PERMISSIBLE ERROR VALUE, IOPT SPECIFIES THE EXTERNAL
01225 C   MODEL VERSION, THE ARRAY PARMOD CONTAINS INPUT PARAMETERS FOR THAT MODEL
01226 C   EXNAME IS THE NAME OF THE EXTERNAL FIELD SUBROUTINE
01227 C   INNAME IS THE NAME OF THE INTERNAL FIELD SUBROUTINE (EITHER DIP OR IGRF)
01228 C
01229 C   ALL THE PARAMETERS ARE INPUT ONES; OUTPUT IS THE RENEWED TRIPLET X,Y,Z
01230 C
01231 C     LAST MODIFICATION:  MARCH 31, 2003
01232 C
01233 C     AUTHOR:  N. A. TSYGANENKO
01234 C
01235       DIMENSION PARMOD(10)
01236       COMMON /GEOPACK1/ A(26),DS3,B(8)
01237       EXTERNAL EXNAME,INNAME
01238 
01239   1   DS3=-DS/3.
01240       CALL RHAND (X,Y,Z,R11,R12,R13,IOPT,PARMOD,EXNAME,INNAME)
01241       CALL RHAND (X+R11,Y+R12,Z+R13,R21,R22,R23,IOPT,PARMOD,EXNAME,
01242      * INNAME)
01243       CALL RHAND (X+.5*(R11+R21),Y+.5*(R12+R22),Z+.5*
01244      *(R13+R23),R31,R32,R33,IOPT,PARMOD,EXNAME,INNAME)
01245       CALL RHAND (X+.375*(R11+3.*R31),Y+.375*(R12+3.*R32
01246      *),Z+.375*(R13+3.*R33),R41,R42,R43,IOPT,PARMOD,EXNAME,INNAME)
01247       CALL RHAND (X+1.5*(R11-3.*R31+4.*R41),Y+1.5*(R12-
01248      *3.*R32+4.*R42),Z+1.5*(R13-3.*R33+4.*R43),
01249      *R51,R52,R53,IOPT,PARMOD,EXNAME,INNAME)
01250       ERRCUR=ABS(R11-4.5*R31+4.*R41-.5*R51)+ABS(R12-4.5*R32+4.*R42-.5*
01251      *R52)+ABS(R13-4.5*R33+4.*R43-.5*R53)
01252       IF (ERRCUR.LT.ERRIN) GOTO 2
01253       DS=DS*.5
01254       GOTO 1
01255   2   X=X+.5*(R11+4.*R41+R51)
01256       Y=Y+.5*(R12+4.*R42+R52)
01257       Z=Z+.5*(R13+4.*R43+R53)
01258       IF(ERRCUR.LT.ERRIN*.04.AND.ABS(DS).LT.1.33) DS=DS*1.5
01259       RETURN
01260       END
01261 C
01262 C==============================================================================
01263 C
01264       SUBROUTINE TRACE (XI,YI,ZI,DIR,RLIM,R0,IOPT,PARMOD,EXNAME,INNAME,
01265      *XF,YF,ZF,XX,YY,ZZ,L)
01266       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01267 C
01268 C  TRACES A FIELD LINE FROM AN ARBITRARY POINT OF SPACE TO THE EARTH'S
01269 C  SURFACE OR TO A MODEL LIMITING BOUNDARY.
01270 C
01271 C  THE HIGHEST ORDER OF SPHERICAL HARMONICS IN THE MAIN FIELD EXPANSION USED
01272 C  IN THE MAPPING IS CALCULATED AUTOMATICALLY. IF INNAME=IGRF_GSM, THEN AN IGRF MODEL
01273 C  FIELD WILL BE USED, AND IF INNAME=DIP, A PURE DIPOLE FIELD WILL BE USED.
01274 
01275 C  IN ANY CASE, BEFORE CALLING TRACE, ONE SHOULD INVOKE RECALC, TO CALCULATE CORRECT
01276 C  VALUES OF THE IGRF COEFFICIENTS AND ALL QUANTITIES NEEDED FOR TRANSFORMATIONS
01277 C  BETWEEN COORDINATE SYSTEMS INVOLVED IN THIS CALCULATIONS.
01278 C
01279 C  ALTERNATIVELY, THE SUBROUTINE RECALC CAN BE INVOKED WITH THE DESIRED VALUES OF
01280 C  IYEAR AND IDAY (TO SPECIFY THE DIPOLE MOMENT), WHILE THE VALUES OF THE DIPOLE
01281 C  TILT ANGLE PSI (IN RADIANS) AND ITS SINE (SPS) AND COSINE (CPS) CAN BE EXPLICITLY
01282 C  SPECIFIED AND FORWARDED TO THE COMMON BLOCK GEOPACK1 (11th, 12th, AND 16th ELEMENTS, RESP.)
01283 C
01284 C------------- INPUT PARAMETERS:
01285 C
01286 C   XI,YI,ZI - GSM COORDS OF INITIAL POINT (IN EARTH RADII, 1 RE = 6371.2 km),
01287 C
01288 C   DIR - SIGN OF THE TRACING DIRECTION: IF DIR=1.0 THEN WE MOVE ANTIPARALLEL TO THE
01289 C     FIELD VECTOR (E.G. FROM NORTHERN TO SOUTHERN CONJUGATE POINT),
01290 C     AND IF DIR=-1.0 THEN THE TRACING GOES IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION.
01291 C
01292 C   R0 -  RADIUS OF A SPHERE (IN RE) FOR WHICH THE FIELD LINE ENDPOINT COORDINATES
01293 C     XF,YF,ZF  SHOULD BE CALCULATED.
01294 C
01295 C   RLIM - UPPER LIMIT OF THE GEOCENTRIC DISTANCE, WHERE THE TRACING IS TERMINATED.
01296 C
01297 C   IOPT - A MODEL INDEX; CAN BE USED FOR SPECIFYING AN OPTION OF THE EXTERNAL FIELD
01298 C       MODEL (E.G., INTERVAL OF THE KP-INDEX). ALTERNATIVELY, ONE CAN USE THE ARRAY
01299 C       PARMOD FOR THAT PURPOSE (SEE BELOW); IN THAT CASE IOPT IS JUST A DUMMY PARAMETER.
01300 C
01301 C   PARMOD -  A 10-ELEMENT ARRAY CONTAINING MODEL PARAMETERS, NEEDED FOR A UNIQUE
01302 C      SPECIFICATION OF THE EXTERNAL FIELD. THE CONCRETE MEANING OF THE COMPONENTS
01303 C      OF PARMOD DEPENDS ON A SPECIFIC VERSION OF THE EXTERNAL FIELD MODEL.
01304 C
01305 C   EXNAME - NAME OF A SUBROUTINE PROVIDING COMPONENTS OF THE EXTERNAL MAGNETIC FIELD
01306 C    (E.G., T96_01).
01307 C   INNAME - NAME OF A SUBROUTINE PROVIDING COMPONENTS OF THE INTERNAL MAGNETIC FIELD
01308 C    (EITHER DIP OR IGRF_GSM).
01309 C
01310 C-------------- OUTPUT PARAMETERS:
01311 C
01312 C   XF,YF,ZF - GSM COORDS OF THE LAST CALCULATED POINT OF A FIELD LINE
01313 C   XX,YY,ZZ - ARRAYS, CONTAINING COORDS OF FIELD LINE POINTS. HERE THEIR MAXIMAL LENGTH WAS
01314 C      ASSUMED EQUAL TO 999.
01315 C   L - ACTUAL NUMBER OF THE CALCULATED FIELD LINE POINTS. IF L EXCEEDS 999, TRACING
01316 C     TERMINATES, AND A WARNING IS DISPLAYED.
01317 C
01318 C
01319 C     LAST MODIFICATION:  MARCH 31, 2003.
01320 C
01321 C     AUTHOR:  N. A. TSYGANENKO
01322 C
01323       DIMENSION XX(1000),YY(1000),ZZ(1000), PARMOD(10)
01324       COMMON /GEOPACK1/ AA(26),DD,BB(8)
01325       EXTERNAL EXNAME,INNAME
01326 C
01327       ERR=0.0001
01328       L=0
01329       DS=0.5*DIR
01330       X=XI
01331       Y=YI
01332       Z=ZI
01333       DD=DIR
01334       AL=0.
01335 c
01336 c  here we call RHAND just to find out the sign of the radial component of the field
01337 c   vector, and to determine the initial direction of the tracing (i.e., either away
01338 c   or towards Earth):
01339 c
01340       CALL RHAND (X,Y,Z,R1,R2,R3,IOPT,PARMOD,EXNAME,INNAME)
01341       AD=0.01
01342       IF (X*R1+Y*R2+Z*R3.LT.0.) AD=-0.01
01343 C
01344 c     |AD|=0.01 and its sign follows the rule:
01345 c (1) if DIR=1 (tracing antiparallel to B vector) then the sign of AD is the same as of Br
01346 c (2) if DIR=-1 (tracing parallel to B vector) then the sign of AD is opposite to that of Br
01347 c     AD is defined in order to initialize the value of RR (radial distance at previous step):
01348 
01349       RR=SQRT(X**2+Y**2+Z**2)+AD
01350   1   L=L+1
01351       IF(L.GT.999) GOTO 7
01352       XX(L)=X
01353       YY(L)=Y
01354       ZZ(L)=Z
01355       RYZ=Y**2+Z**2
01356       R2=X**2+RYZ
01357       R=SQRT(R2)
01358 
01359 c  check if the line hit the outer tracing boundary; if yes, then terminate
01360 c   the tracing (label 8):
01361 
01362       IF (R.GT.RLIM.OR.RYZ.GT.1600.D0.OR.X.GT.20.D0) GOTO 8
01363 c
01364 c  check whether or not the inner tracing boundary was crossed from outside,
01365 c  if yes, then calculate the footpoint position by interpolation (go to label 6):
01366 c
01367       IF (R.LT.R0.AND.RR.GT.R) GOTO 6
01368 
01369 c  check if (i) we are moving outward, or (ii) we are still sufficiently
01370 c    far from Earth (beyond R=5Re); if yes, proceed further:
01371 c
01372       IF (R.GE.RR.OR.R.GT.5.) GOTO 5
01373 
01374 c  now we moved closer inward (between R=3 and R=5); go to 3 and begin logging
01375 c  previous values of X,Y,Z, to be used in the interpolation (after having
01376 c  crossed the inner tracing boundary):
01377 
01378       IF (R.GE.3.) GOTO 3
01379 c
01380 c  we entered inside the sphere R=3: to avoid too large steps (and hence inaccurate
01381 c  interpolated position of the footpoint), enforce the progressively smaller
01382 c  stepsize values as we approach the inner boundary R=R0:
01383 c
01384       FC=0.2
01385       IF(R-R0.LT.0.05) FC=0.05
01386       AL=FC*(R-R0+0.2)
01387       DS=DIR*AL
01388       GOTO 4
01389   3   DS=DIR
01390   4   XR=X
01391       YR=Y
01392       ZR=Z
01393   5   RR=R
01394       CALL STEP (X,Y,Z,DS,ERR,IOPT,PARMOD,EXNAME,INNAME)
01395       GOTO 1
01396 c
01397 c  find the footpoint position by interpolating between the current and previous
01398 c   field line points:
01399 c
01400   6   R1=(R0-R)/(RR-R)
01401       X=X-(X-XR)*R1
01402       Y=Y-(Y-YR)*R1
01403       Z=Z-(Z-ZR)*R1
01404       GOTO 8
01405   7   WRITE (*,10)
01406       L=999
01407   8   XF=X
01408       YF=Y
01409       ZF=Z
01410       RETURN
01411  10   FORMAT(//,1X,'**** COMPUTATIONS IN THE SUBROUTINE TRACE ARE',
01412      *' TERMINATED: THE CURRENT NUMBER OF POINTS EXCEEDED 1000 ****'//)
01413       END
01414 c
01415 C====================================================================================
01416 C
01417       SUBROUTINE SHUETAL_MGNP(XN_PD,VEL,BZIMF,XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM,
01418      *  XMGNP,YMGNP,ZMGNP,DIST,ID)
01419       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01420 C
01421 C  FOR ANY POINT OF SPACE WITH COORDINATES (XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM) AND SPECIFIED CONDITIONS
01422 C  IN THE INCOMING SOLAR WIND, THIS SUBROUTINE:
01423 C
01424 C (1) DETERMINES IF THE POINT (XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM) LIES INSIDE OR OUTSIDE THE
01425 C      MODEL MAGNETOPAUSE OF SHUE ET AL. (JGR-A, V.103, P. 17691, 1998).
01426 C
01427 C (2) CALCULATES THE GSM POSITION OF A POINT {XMGNP,YMGNP,ZMGNP}, LYING AT THE MODEL
01428 C      MAGNETOPAUSE AND ASYMPTOTICALLY TENDING TO THE NEAREST BOUNDARY POINT WITH
01429 C      RESPECT TO THE OBSERVATION POINT {XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM}, AS IT APPROACHES THE MAGNETO-
01430 C      PAUSE.
01431 C
01432 C  INPUT: XN_PD - EITHER SOLAR WIND PROTON NUMBER DENSITY (PER C.C.) (IF VEL>0)
01433 C                    OR THE SOLAR WIND RAM PRESSURE IN NANOPASCALS   (IF VEL<0)
01434 C         BZIMF - IMF BZ IN NANOTESLAS
01435 C
01436 C         VEL - EITHER SOLAR WIND VELOCITY (KM/SEC)
01437 C                  OR ANY NEGATIVE NUMBER, WHICH INDICATES THAT XN_PD STANDS
01438 C                     FOR THE SOLAR WIND PRESSURE, RATHER THAN FOR THE DENSITY
01439 C
01440 C         XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM - GSM POSITION OF THE OBSERVATION POINT IN EARTH RADII
01441 C
01442 C  OUTPUT: XMGNP,YMGNP,ZMGNP - GSM POSITION OF THE BOUNDARY POINT
01443 C          DIST - DISTANCE (IN RE) BETWEEN THE OBSERVATION POINT (XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM)
01444 C                 AND THE MODEL NAGNETOPAUSE
01445 C          ID -  POSITION FLAG:  ID=+1 (-1) MEANS THAT THE OBSERVATION POINT
01446 C          LIES INSIDE (OUTSIDE) OF THE MODEL MAGNETOPAUSE, RESPECTIVELY.
01447 C
01448 C  OTHER SUBROUTINES USED: T96_MGNP
01449 C
01450 c          AUTHOR:  N.A. TSYGANENKO,
01451 C          DATE:    APRIL 4, 2003.
01452 C
01453       IF (VEL.LT.0.) THEN
01454         PD=XN_PD
01455       ELSE
01456         PD=1.94E-6*XN_PD*VEL**2  ! PD IS THE SOLAR WIND DYNAMIC PRESSURE (IN nPa)
01457       ENDIF
01458 
01459 c
01460 c  DEFINE THE ANGLE PHI, MEASURED DUSKWARD FROM THE NOON-MIDNIGHT MERIDIAN PLANE;
01461 C  IF THE OBSERVATION POINT LIES ON THE X AXIS, THE ANGLE PHI CANNOT BE UNIQUELY
01462 C  DEFINED, AND WE SET IT AT ZERO:
01463 c
01464       IF (YGSM.NE.0..OR.ZGSM.NE.0.) THEN
01465          PHI=ATAN2(YGSM,ZGSM)
01466       ELSE
01467          PHI=0.
01468       ENDIF
01469 C
01470 C  FIRST, FIND OUT IF THE OBSERVATION POINT LIES INSIDE THE SHUE ET AL BDRY
01471 C  AND SET THE VALUE OF THE ID FLAG:
01472 C
01473       ID=-1
01474       R0=(10.22+1.29*TANH(0.184*(BZIMF+8.14)))*PD**(-.15151515)
01475       ALPHA=(0.58-0.007*BZIMF)*(1.+0.024*DLOG(PD))
01476       R=SQRT(XGSM**2+YGSM**2+ZGSM**2)
01477       RM=R0*(2./(1.+XGSM/R))**ALPHA
01478       IF (R.LE.RM) ID=+1
01479 C
01480 C  NOW, FIND THE CORRESPONDING T96 MAGNETOPAUSE POSITION, TO BE USED AS
01481 C  A STARTING APPROXIMATION IN THE SEARCH OF A CORRESPONDING SHUE ET AL.
01482 C  BOUNDARY POINT:
01483 C
01484       CALL T96_MGNP (PD,-1.D0,XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM,XMT96,YMT96,
01485      * ZMT96,DIST,ID96)
01486 C
01487       RHO2=YMT96**2+ZMT96**2
01488       R=SQRT(RHO2+XMT96**2)
01489       ST=SQRT(RHO2)/R
01490       CT=XMT96/R
01491 C
01492 C  NOW, USE NEWTON'S ITERATIVE METHOD TO FIND THE NEAREST POINT AT THE
01493 C   SHUE ET AL.'S BOUNDARY:
01494 C
01495       NIT=0
01496 
01497   1   T=ATAN2(ST,CT)
01498       RM=R0*(2./(1.+CT))**ALPHA
01499 
01500       F=R-RM
01501       GRADF_R=1.
01502       GRADF_T=-ALPHA/R*RM*ST/(1.+CT)
01503       GRADF=SQRT(GRADF_R**2+GRADF_T**2)
01504 
01505       DR=-F/GRADF**2
01506       DT= DR/R*GRADF_T
01507 
01508       R=R+DR
01509       T=T+DT
01510       ST=SIN(T)
01511       CT=COS(T)
01512 
01513       DS=SQRT(DR**2+(R*DT)**2)
01514 
01515       NIT=NIT+1
01516 
01517       IF (NIT.GT.1000) THEN
01518          PRINT *,
01519      *' BOUNDARY POINT COULD NOT BE FOUND; ITERATIONS DO NOT CONVERGE'
01520       ENDIF
01521 
01522       IF (DS.GT.1.E-4) GOTO 1
01523 
01524       XMGNP=R*COS(T)
01525       RHO=  R*SIN(T)
01526 
01527       YMGNP=RHO*SIN(PHI)
01528       ZMGNP=RHO*COS(PHI)
01529 
01530       DIST=SQRT((XGSM-XMGNP)**2+(YGSM-YMGNP)**2+(ZGSM-ZMGNP)**2)
01531 
01532       RETURN
01533       END
01534 C
01535 C=======================================================================================
01536 C
01537       SUBROUTINE T96_MGNP (XN_PD,VEL,XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM,XMGNP,YMGNP,ZMGNP,
01538      * DIST,ID)
01539       IMPLICIT REAL*8 (A-H,O-Z)
01540 C
01541 C  FOR ANY POINT OF SPACE WITH GIVEN COORDINATES (XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM), THIS SUBROUTINE DEFINES
01542 C  THE POSITION OF A POINT (XMGNP,YMGNP,ZMGNP) AT THE T96 MODEL MAGNETOPAUSE, HAVING THE
01543 C  SAME VALUE OF THE ELLIPSOIDAL TAU-COORDINATE, AND THE DISTANCE BETWEEN THEM.  THIS IS
01544 C  NOT THE SHORTEST DISTANCE D_MIN TO THE BOUNDARY, BUT DIST ASYMPTOTICALLY TENDS TO D_MIN,
01545 C  AS THE OBSERVATION POINT GETS CLOSER TO THE MAGNETOPAUSE.
01546 C
01547 C  INPUT: XN_PD - EITHER SOLAR WIND PROTON NUMBER DENSITY (PER C.C.) (IF VEL>0)
01548 C                    OR THE SOLAR WIND RAM PRESSURE IN NANOPASCALS   (IF VEL<0)
01549 C         VEL - EITHER SOLAR WIND VELOCITY (KM/SEC)
01550 C                  OR ANY NEGATIVE NUMBER, WHICH INDICATES THAT XN_PD STANDS
01551 C                     FOR THE SOLAR WIND PRESSURE, RATHER THAN FOR THE DENSITY
01552 C
01553 C         XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM - COORDINATES OF THE OBSERVATION POINT IN EARTH RADII
01554 C
01555 C  OUTPUT: XMGNP,YMGNP,ZMGNP - GSM POSITION OF THE BOUNDARY POINT, HAVING THE SAME
01556 C          VALUE OF TAU-COORDINATE AS THE OBSERVATION POINT (XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM)
01557 C          DIST -  THE DISTANCE BETWEEN THE TWO POINTS, IN RE,
01558 C          ID -    POSITION FLAG; ID=+1 (-1) MEANS THAT THE POINT (XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM)
01559 C          LIES INSIDE (OUTSIDE) THE MODEL MAGNETOPAUSE, RESPECTIVELY.
01560 C
01561 C  THE PRESSURE-DEPENDENT MAGNETOPAUSE IS THAT USED IN THE T96_01 MODEL
01562 C  (TSYGANENKO, JGR, V.100, P.5599, 1995; ESA SP-389, P.181, OCT. 1996)
01563 C
01564 c   AUTHOR:  N.A. TSYGANENKO
01565 C   DATE:    AUG.1, 1995, REVISED APRIL 3, 2003.
01566 C
01567 C
01568 C  DEFINE SOLAR WIND DYNAMIC PRESSURE (NANOPASCALS, ASSUMING 4% OF ALPHA-PARTICLES),
01569 C   IF NOT EXPLICITLY SPECIFIED IN THE INPUT:
01570 
01571       IF (VEL.LT.0.) THEN
01572        PD=XN_PD
01573       ELSE
01574        PD=1.94E-6*XN_PD*VEL**2
01575 C
01576       ENDIF
01577 C
01578 C  RATIO OF PD TO THE AVERAGE PRESSURE, ASSUMED EQUAL TO 2 nPa:
01579 
01580       RAT=PD/2.0
01581       RAT16=RAT**0.14
01582 
01583 C (THE POWER INDEX 0.14 IN THE SCALING FACTOR IS THE BEST-FIT VALUE OBTAINED FROM DATA
01584 C    AND USED IN THE T96_01 VERSION)
01585 C
01586 C  VALUES OF THE MAGNETOPAUSE PARAMETERS FOR  PD = 2 nPa:
01587 C
01588       A0=70.
01589       S00=1.08
01590       X00=5.48
01591 C
01592 C   VALUES OF THE MAGNETOPAUSE PARAMETERS, SCALED BY THE ACTUAL PRESSURE:
01593 C
01594       A=A0/RAT16
01595       S0=S00
01596       X0=X00/RAT16
01597       XM=X0-A
01598 C
01599 C  (XM IS THE X-COORDINATE OF THE "SEAM" BETWEEN THE ELLIPSOID AND THE CYLINDER)
01600 C
01601 C     (FOR DETAILS ON THE ELLIPSOIDAL COORDINATES, SEE THE PAPER:
01602 C      N.A.TSYGANENKO, SOLUTION OF CHAPMAN-FERRARO PROBLEM FOR AN
01603 C      ELLIPSOIDAL MAGNETOPAUSE, PLANET.SPACE SCI., V.37, P.1037, 1989).
01604 C
01605        IF (YGSM.NE.0..OR.ZGSM.NE.0.) THEN
01606           PHI=ATAN2(YGSM,ZGSM)
01607        ELSE
01608           PHI=0.
01609        ENDIF
01610 C
01611        RHO=SQRT(YGSM**2+ZGSM**2)
01612 C
01613        IF (XGSM.LT.XM) THEN
01614            XMGNP=XGSM
01615            RHOMGNP=A*SQRT(S0**2-1)
01616            YMGNP=RHOMGNP*SIN(PHI)
01617            ZMGNP=RHOMGNP*COS(PHI)
01618            DIST=SQRT((XGSM-XMGNP)**2+(YGSM-YMGNP)**2+(ZGSM-ZMGNP)**2)
01619            IF (RHOMGNP.GT.RHO) ID=+1
01620            IF (RHOMGNP.LE.RHO) ID=-1
01621            RETURN
01622        ENDIF
01623 C
01624           XKSI=(XGSM-X0)/A+1.
01625           XDZT=RHO/A
01626           SQ1=SQRT((1.+XKSI)**2+XDZT**2)
01627           SQ2=SQRT((1.-XKSI)**2+XDZT**2)
01628           SIGMA=0.5*(SQ1+SQ2)
01629           TAU=0.5*(SQ1-SQ2)
01630 C
01631 C  NOW CALCULATE (X,Y,Z) FOR THE CLOSEST POINT AT THE MAGNETOPAUSE
01632 C
01633           XMGNP=X0-A*(1.-S0*TAU)
01634           ARG=(S0**2-1.)*(1.-TAU**2)
01635           IF (ARG.LT.0.) ARG=0.
01636           RHOMGNP=A*SQRT(ARG)
01637           YMGNP=RHOMGNP*SIN(PHI)
01638           ZMGNP=RHOMGNP*COS(PHI)
01639 C
01640 C  NOW CALCULATE THE DISTANCE BETWEEN THE POINTS {XGSM,YGSM,ZGSM} AND {XMGNP,YMGNP,ZMGNP}:
01641 C   (IN GENERAL, THIS IS NOT THE SHORTEST DISTANCE D_MIN, BUT DIST ASYMPTOTICALLY TENDS
01642 C    TO D_MIN, AS WE ARE GETTING CLOSER TO THE MAGNETOPAUSE):
01643 C
01644       DIST=SQRT((XGSM-XMGNP)**2+(YGSM-YMGNP)**2+(ZGSM-ZMGNP)**2)
01645 C
01646       IF (SIGMA.GT.S0) ID=-1   !  ID=-1 MEANS THAT THE POINT LIES OUTSIDE
01647       IF (SIGMA.LE.S0) ID=+1   !  ID=+1 MEANS THAT THE POINT LIES INSIDE
01648 C                                           THE MAGNETOSPHERE
01649       RETURN
01650       END
01651 C
01652 C===================================================================================
01653 C
01654 c</pre>
